question.title: Will Coca-Cola recall any products due to metal contamination by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Coca-Cola announces a recall of any of its products due to metal contamination. The recall must be officially confirmed by Coca-Cola or a relevant food safety authority (such as the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, CNN, New York Times). The contamination must specifically involve metal materials found in the food products. If no such recall occurs within the specified timeframe, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

2. A press release from Land O'Frost
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Land O'Frost recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Google's AI assistant be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Google's AI assistant is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election misinformation. For this inquiry, 'election-related falsehoods' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive information regarding electoral procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference the AI assistant and its involvement in disseminating election-related falsehoods. If no such accounts or alerts are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be indications of Google's AI assistant spreading false information related to elections by August 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, reliable reports or official notifications from election authorities, government agencies, or reputable news organizations suggest that Google's AI assistant is spreading false information related to elections. In this context, 'false information related to elections' refers to incorrect or misleading details regarding voting processes, candidates, or results. Reliable reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or large US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in credible journals. The reports or notifications must specifically mention the AI assistant and its role in spreading election-related falsehoods. If no such reports or notifications are made by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will the CMA announce completion of a major digital advertising practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into digital advertising practices involving at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official CMA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the CMA declare that a significant inquiry into digital advertising practices has concluded by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) makes an official statement regarding the conclusion of its investigation into digital advertising practices that involve at least five prominent companies. The conclusion must be verified through a formal announcement from the CMA or reported by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the CMA fails to announce the conclusion of this investigation by the specified date, or if the investigation remains active, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Union Pacific implement a new scheduling system for freight train operations by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific Railroad announces and implements a new scheduling system aimed at making schedules more predictable for freight train operations. The implementation must be confirmed through official company statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The new system must be specifically designed to address the quality of life concerns related to schedule predictability for freight train operations. If no such system is implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, or if the implemented system does not specifically target schedule predictability for freight train operations, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a community engagement requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a community engagement requirement for beneficiaries. question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a significant cybersecurity firm completely shift its headquarters to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a significant cybersecurity firm has entirely moved its headquarters from its previous location to Austin, Texas. For the answer to be YES:

1. The move must be officially declared by the company or its executives.
2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, trustworthy news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with essential executive functions transferred.

Any partial relocations or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not suffice for a YES answer. If the relocation is not finalized and functioning by this date, or if the company opts against the relocation, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a prominent cybersecurity firm's main office be entirely moved to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, a significant cybersecurity firm has completely shifted its main office from its previous location to Austin, Texas. For a YES resolution to be granted:

2. The declaration must be covered by at least two major, credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new main office must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive operations relocated.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control measures by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on gun control measures. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address gun control, either proposing to introduce new regulations or to relax existing ones. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on gun control does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Arkansas Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Apple's Siri is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Georgia state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the FTC announce completion of a major pricing practices investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) officially announces the completion of its investigation into pricing practices that use personal data to set prices based on individual shopper characteristics. The investigation must involve at least five major companies. Completion must be confirmed through an official FTC announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FTC does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage exceed 5.5% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 5.5%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not exceed 5.5% at any point during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. For clarity, the rate must surpass 5.5%, not merely equal it.

The rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or other credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. If the rate does not surpass 5.5% at any time during August 2024, the answer will be NO. To clarify, the rate must exceed 5.5%, not simply match it.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Cracker Jack brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Cracker Jack in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Pennsylvania conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Pennsylvania conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Pennsylvania.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Reserve Bank of India and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Italian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Italian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Italian National Institute of Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the Italian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). question.title: Will the United Kingdom's House of Lords pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Sunak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United Kingdom's House of Lords passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Rishi Sunak or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

If no such bill is passed by the House of Lords by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

   1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
   2. It must be passed by the House of Lords, regardless of whether it becomes law.
   3. The opposition from Prime Minister Sunak or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
   4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the UK economy.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Apple has finalized and officially signed a collective bargaining contract with the unionized store employees in Ohio. question.body:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.

6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will India eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such policy is introduced or implemented by the resolution date, or if only partial measures are taken, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will India remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government makes an official declaration or enacts a policy to fully abolish export duties on agricultural goods. The policy must be validated by official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press). Any partial reductions in export duties or the removal of duties on only certain agricultural goods will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such policy is introduced or enacted by the resolution date, or if only partial actions are taken, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) the Bank of England announces an interest rate cut by August 2024, and (b) India eliminates export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if both of the following occur: (a) The Bank of England officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of England communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for monetary policy. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government officially announces or implements a policy to completely eliminate export taxes on agricultural products. The policy must be confirmed by official government communications or reported by at least two reputable international news outlets, such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press. Partial reductions in export taxes or the elimination of taxes on only some agricultural products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If both conditions are not met by their respective resolution dates, the question resolves as NO.

This announcement must be validated by official communications from the Bank of England, including press releases, statements from the Monetary Policy Committee, or public addresses by Bank officials. The actual date when the rate cut takes effect may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Bank Rate, which serves as the primary instrument of monetary policy for the Bank of England. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government makes an official announcement or takes action to fully abolish export taxes on agricultural products. This policy must be confirmed through official government announcements or reported by at least two credible international news sources, such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or Associated Press. A mere partial reduction of export taxes or the removal of taxes on only certain agricultural products will not suffice for a YES resolution. If either of the conditions is not fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will India's central bank's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if India's central bank's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Reserve Bank of India or a relevant Indian government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the inflation metric favored by India's central bank indicate a monthly rise surpassing 0.5%?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if the inflation metric favored by India's central bank displays a month-over-month rise exceeding 0.5% in any single month from October 2023 to July 31, 2024. The rise must be officially documented by the Reserve Bank of India or an appropriate Indian governmental body and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Economic Times). It is important to note that this question pertains to the month-over-month variation, rather than year-over-year or any other duration.

question.title: Will Uber lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Uber has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Uber confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Elon Musk conduct a live interview with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Elon Musk conducts a live interview with Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) by August 31, 2024. For a positive resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The interview must be conducted live on the X platform.
2. Elon Musk must be the primary interviewer.
3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
4. The event must be officially announced by X or Elon Musk prior to its occurrence.
5. The interview must be publicly accessible on the X platform.
6. At least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.

If all these conditions are met by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as YES. If any of these conditions are not met by this date, or if the interview does not occur, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will both of the following events occur: (a) Elon Musk engages in a live dialogue with Satya Nadella on X by August 2024 and (b) Nvidia will announce measures to reduce electricity consumption associated with AI by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will receive a YES if both of the following events happen:

(a) A live dialogue between Elon Musk and Satya Nadella on X (formerly known as Twitter) occurs by August 31, 2024. For a YES outcome, the following conditions must be met:
   1. The dialogue must be held live on the X platform.
   2. Elon Musk must act as the primary interviewer.
   3. Satya Nadella must be the interviewee.
   4. The event should be officially announced by either X or Elon Musk in advance.
   5. The dialogue must be accessible to the public on the X platform.
   6. At least two major news outlets (like CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, Reuters, or Associated Press) must report on the event either before or after it takes place.
   If all these conditions are satisfied by August 31, 2024, this part will be a YES. If any of these conditions are unmet by that date, or if the dialogue does not take place, this part will be a NO.

(b) Nvidia officially announces specific steps aimed at reducing electricity usage related to its AI operations by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be made through official channels (such as press releases, blog entries, or annual reports) or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The actions disclosed should be concrete measures intended to decrease the energy consumption of Nvidia's AI technologies. If no such announcement is made by the deadline, or if the disclosed actions do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, this part will be a NO.

The overall question will be answered with a YES if both parts (a) and (b) are answered with YES. Otherwise, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will Samsung announce plans to increase its AI-related workforce by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Samsung publicly announces plans to increase its AI-related workforce. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, investor relations statements, or official social media accounts) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, Wall Street Journal). The increase in AI-related workforce must be explicitly stated and not inferred from general hiring plans. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if Samsung only announces maintaining or decreasing its AI-related workforce, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question is about the announcement of plans, not the actual implementation of those plans.

If no such declaration is made by the designated date, or if Samsung only reveals plans to maintain or reduce its AI-related workforce, the inquiry will be deemed negative. question.title: Will the Mexican economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Mexican economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The question resolves as NO if the Mexican economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will Mexico's economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Mexico's economy does not fall into a recession. For the sake of this question, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as indicated by the National Institute of Statistics and Geography of Mexico. The inquiry will be deemed negative if Mexico's economy encounters two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Sony Corporation resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Sony Corporation reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Sony Corporation workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Sony Corporation and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the S&P 500 index reach or exceed 4,800 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the S&P 500 index reaches or exceeds 4,800 points. The 4,800 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the New York Stock Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,800 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,800 points.

question.title: Will the Philippine government enforce a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are confirmed reports that the Philippine government has successfully enforced a shutdown of Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines. The enforcement must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or CNN) and involve official government actions leading to the cessation of operations for a significant number of these trading platforms. 'Significant' in this context means at least 50% of known Chinese-run online trading platforms in the Philippines at the time of enforcement. The shutdown must be a result of government policy or directive, not due to voluntary closures or economic factors. If no such enforcement meeting these criteria is confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will California conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, California conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the La Familia Michoacana drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such official declaration meeting these criteria is made by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will large protests occur in the United Kingdom in response to healthcare funding cuts by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in the United Kingdom specifically in response to the government's decision to cut healthcare funding. To qualify as 'large', the protests must involve at least 1,000 participants in a single gathering or multiple coordinated gatherings totaling at least 1,000 participants across the United Kingdom. The protests must be explicitly linked to the issue of healthcare funding cuts. If no such protests meeting these criteria occur by the specified date, or if the funding cuts are rescinded before causing such protests, the question will resolve as NO.

The UFCW endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If either or both of these events do not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Tostitos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Tostitos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Tostitos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 200,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 200,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Reserve Bank of Australia will declare a reduction in interest rates by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of Australia publicly proclaims a reduction in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The reduction in interest rates must be a formal resolution made by the Reserve Bank Board and conveyed in their official communication or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks from individual RBA members will not be taken into account for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (1) A court ruling on the liability of a major hotel chain operator and (2) The Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure showing a monthly increase exceeding 0.5%?
question.body: (1) This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. The ruling must be documented in official court records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or The New York Times). If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability. (2) This question will resolve as YES if the Federal Reserve's preferred inflation measure (typically the Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index or PCE) reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Federal Reserve or a relevant U.S. government agency (such as the Bureau of Economic Analysis) and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage exceed 7.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or The Wall Street Journal. question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Google come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Google successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For a valid resolution:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must endure for a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Google and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be covered by no fewer than two credible international news organizations (such as Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all these conditions is reached by the designated date, or if no significant strike takes place, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.body:
This question resolves as YES if both of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024:

(a) The United Food and Commercial Workers (UFCW) publicly endorses a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. For this to resolve as YES, the endorsement must be confirmed through official UFCW statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If no such endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO.

(b) Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For this to resolve as YES, the strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied by the specified date.

question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces a decrease in its cash rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of Australia or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Reserve Bank Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBA members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the New York state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will Alibaba Group resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Alibaba Group reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Alibaba Group workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Alibaba Group and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Google reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Will the French economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the French economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The question resolves as NO if the French economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the French economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the French economy has not entered a recession by July 31, 2024. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth, as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies of France. The response will be NO if the French economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, through July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico's preferred inflation measure reports a month-over-month increase greater than 0.5% in any single month between October 2023 and July 31, 2024. The increase must be officially published by the Central Bank of Mexico or a relevant Mexican government agency and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, El Financiero). If no such increase is reported during this period, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question focuses on the month-over-month change, not year-over-year or any other time frame.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on housing affordability by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Minnesota officially conducts a referendum regarding housing affordability. The referendum must be a formal, state-wide vote on a proposed constitutional amendment or legislative measure specifically addressing housing affordability. The occurrence of the referendum must be verifiable through official state government announcements or reports from at least three major, reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). If no such referendum is held by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the referendum itself, not its outcome.

question.title: Will Illinois maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Illinois Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). (2) By August 31, 2024, a new Department of Health and Human Services rule specifically targeting the regulation of telehealth services is enacted through legal or administrative means. Enactment must be confirmed through official announcements by the HHS, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The rule must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If either condition is not met by their respective deadlines, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Facebook's AI content moderation system be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that Facebook's AI content moderation system is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Facebook's AI system and its role in spreading election misinformation. The question will resolve as NO if no such vote occurs by August 31, 2024, if a planned vote is cancelled or delayed beyond the specified date, or if a vote is conducted but does not specifically focus on establishing protections for abortion rights. Note: This question does not take into account the outcome of the vote, only whether it occurs within the specified timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the above criteria are not fulfilled.

para_P.title: Will the following two events take place: (1) A binding ethics code for U.S. Congress members will be implemented by July 2024, and (2) Michigan will conduct a vote regarding abortion rights by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will receive a YES if both of the criteria listed below are satisfied:

1. By July 31, 2024, the United States government must officially enact a binding ethics code specifically for members of Congress. This enactment must be confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (such as The New York Times, The Washington Post, Reuters, or Associated Press). The ethics code should be legally enforceable and applicable to all current members of Congress, outlining clear standards of conduct and enforcement mechanisms. If such a code that meets these criteria is not established and officially enacted by the deadline, this aspect of the question will be answered with NO. Note that merely proposing or discussing this code does not qualify for a YES; it must be formally enacted and enforceable.

2. Michigan must officially hold a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state by August 31, 2024. For a YES resolution, the vote must be officially announced and conducted by the Michigan state government, must specifically address abortion rights protection, and the results must be made public through official state channels or reputable news organizations. The question will resolve as NO if no such vote occurs by August 31, 2024, if a scheduled vote is canceled or postponed beyond the specified date, or if a vote is held but does not specifically aim to establish abortion rights protections. Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the vote, only whether it takes place within the given timeframe.

The question will resolve as NO if either or both of the aforementioned criteria are not met.

question.title: Will Google reach a settlement with the UK data protection authority by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Google and the UK data protection authority reach a formal settlement agreement regarding a fine imposed on Google for alleged data protection violations. The settlement must be confirmed by official statements from either party or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The settlement should specifically address the fine imposed by the UK authority on Google. If no such settlement is reached or publicly confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that appeals, ongoing negotiations, or partial settlements do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will a resolution be achieved between Google and the UK data protection authority by the end of August 2024?

It is important to note that appeals, ongoing discussions, or incomplete agreements do not meet the criteria for a positive response.

question.title: Will the European Commission implement a significant tariff on Chinese-made solar panels by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the European Commission officially implements a tariff of 50% or higher on imports of Chinese-made solar panels. The implementation must be confirmed by official European Commission announcements and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Financial Times, or The Economist). The tariff must be specifically targeted at solar panels manufactured in China and not part of a broader tariff on all Chinese goods or all electronic goods. If no such tariff meeting these criteria is implemented by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Mercedes-Benz's quarterly net income increase by over 20% year-over-year by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Mercedes-Benz reports a net income increase of more than 20% for any quarter compared to the same quarter in the previous year, in its official financial statements released by July 31, 2024. The increase must be verified through official company earnings reports or at least three credible financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal). If no such increase is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any specific quarter, but rather any quarter-over-quarter comparison within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as NO if the Canadian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Canada steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by the end of July 2024, the Canadian economy remains free from a recession. A recession is characterized for this question as experiencing two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as documented by Statistics Canada. The answer will be negative if the Canadian economy faces two back-to-back quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can Canada steer clear of a recession before July 2024?

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate remain at or above 13.25% in August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Brazil's Selic rate is reported to be at or above 13.25% at any point during August 2024. Confirmation must come from official Central Bank of Brazil announcements or at least two reputable financial news sources (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Folha de S.Paulo). If the rate is reported to have decreased below 13.25% and remains below this level throughout August 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if the Selic rate set by Brazil's Central Bank is documented at or exceeding 13.25% at any time during August 2024. Verification must be obtained from official announcements by the Central Bank of Brazil or from at least two credible financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or Folha de S.Paulo). question.title: Will Argentine agricultural workers remain on strike through August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural workers in Argentina are still on strike or have not fully resumed normal operations following any current labor dispute. The status of the strike or work resumption must be confirmed by official statements from agricultural organizations, the unions representing the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the workers have fully returned to work and normal operations have resumed before or during August 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial returns to work or limited operations do not count as a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, agricultural laborers in Argentina are still engaged in a strike or have not completely resumed normal work activities following any ongoing labor conflict. The confirmation of the strike's status or the resumption of work must be validated by official announcements from agricultural associations, the unions that represent the workers, or the Argentine government, and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Clarín, La Nación, or Reuters). If the laborers have entirely returned to work and normal operations have been reinstated prior to or during August 2024, the answer will be NO. Any partial return to work or limited operational capacity does not constitute a full resolution of the strike.

para_P.title: Will agricultural laborers in Argentina continue their strike until August 2024?

If the workers have entirely resumed their duties and normal operations are back to usual before or during August 2024, the answer will be negative. Any partial return to work or restricted operations does not equate to a complete resolution of the strike.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made machinery through August 2024?

The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

1. An official announcement on Sara Lee's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Sara Lee
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Sara Lee recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will South Korea's KOSPI index reach or exceed 3,500 points by August 2024?

Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Korea Exchange. If the index does not reach 3,500 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 3,500 points.

question.title: Will Facebook resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Facebook reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Facebook workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Facebook and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Facebook come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if Facebook successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the answer to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Facebook employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
3. The conclusion must be verified by official announcements from both Facebook and the relevant union.
4. The conclusion must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement meeting all these conditions is reached by the stated date, or if no significant strike takes place, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Indonesian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indonesian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Indonesia. The question resolves as NO if the Indonesian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing measles outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted heightened public health responses globally. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Iowa Senate pass a total abortion ban by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Iowa Senate successfully passes legislation enacting a total abortion ban. For the purpose of this question, a 'total abortion ban' refers to legislation that prohibits all or nearly all abortions, with possible exceptions only for cases involving rape, incest, or threat to the mother's life. The passage of such legislation must be confirmed through official Iowa legislative records. If no such legislation is passed by the specified date, or if only partial restrictions are enacted, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only concerns the passage of the bill in the Senate, not its final enactment into law.

question.title: Will New Jersey hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

question.title: Will Takeda allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Takeda officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its gastrointestinal drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news agencies (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The announcement must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever situation, rather than a general global situation regarding Rift Valley fever.

The inquiry will conclude as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to make such an announcement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically mention the East African situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the East African Rift Valley fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the East African Rift Valley fever situation no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The record must be confirmed by data from the Canadian Real Estate Association or other widely recognized real estate data providers such as Royal LePage or RE/MAX. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question focuses on the nominal price, not adjusted for inflation.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England officially announces a decrease in its bank rate by July 31, 2024. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoE members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.body:

question.title: Will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 6.2% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 6.2% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.
