question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Brazil announce a new inflation target by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Brazil officially announces a new inflation target. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Brazil communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the President of the Central Bank of Brazil. The announcement should explicitly state the new inflation target. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Brazil maintains the current inflation target, the question resolves as NO.

The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas, such as press releases, statements from the Monetary Board, or public addresses by Bank representatives. Should there be no such declaration by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the interest rate reduction may occur after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which serves as the primary monetary policy instrument of the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (a) Universal Studios Hollywood workers approve a new labor agreement by July 2024 (b) The Central Bank of the Philippines announces an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, the workers at Universal Studios Hollywood represented by the unions involved in recent negotiations approve a new labor agreement with Universal. The approval must be confirmed by official union announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The agreement in question must be related to the negotiations mentioned in recent news about avoiding a potential strike. If no such approval is confirmed by the resolution date, or if the agreement is rejected, this part resolves as NO.

(b) The Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas communications, such as press releases, Monetary Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

The overall question resolves as YES only if both (a) and (b) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will Facebook implement court-ordered changes to its advertising policies by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Facebook implements any changes to its advertising policies as a result of a federal court ruling related to antitrust concerns. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from Facebook, court documents, or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). Changes may include, but are not limited to, modifications in ad targeting, pricing models, or advertiser agreements. If no such changes are implemented and confirmed by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider any appeals or stay orders that might delay the implementation of changes.

question.title: Will New York conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, New York conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New York.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Hillshire Farm issue a recall of sausage products due to a listeria outbreak by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Hillshire Farm officially announces a recall of any of its sausage products due to a listeria outbreak. The recall must be confirmed through at least one of the following sources:

1. An official announcement on Hillshire Farm's website or social media channels
2. A press release from Hillshire Farm
3. An announcement from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) specifically mentioning a Hillshire Farm recall
4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

The recall must explicitly mention listeria as the reason for the product withdrawal. If no such recall meeting these criteria is announced by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Missouri conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Bayer officially declares or confirms that it will allow the generic production of its cardiovascular medication, effectively not enforcing its patent. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory authorities, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers).

question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. question.title: Will Iowa's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Iowa's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Reserve Bank of India makes a formal declaration of a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing after a meeting. question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.body:

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Chile announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Chile publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Chile and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the monetary policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Chile's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.

3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (a) A new AI platform is reported for spreading election misinformation and (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies announces a $600 million donation to Hispanic-serving universities?

Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. (b) Bloomberg Philanthropies officially announces a donation of $600 million to the endowments of Hispanic-serving universities. question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever situation, not a worldwide Lassa fever context.

The question will be answered with NO if:
1. The WHO does not release such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency classification of the Nigerian Lassa fever situation.

question.title: Will the Singapore Straits Times Index reach or exceed 4,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, the Singapore Straits Times Index reaches or exceeds 4,000 points. The 4,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Singapore Exchange. If the index does not reach 4,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 4,000 points.
